name: clamant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
that demands attention loudly or in an urgent way: One thing that unites them is clamant opposition to the idea of paying more for fuel. The government ordered a preliminary exploration of the matter in response to clamant public demand .
More examplesFewer examplesHe realized that the clamant rudeness of the candidate would almost certainly swing public opinion against her.In Paris, the problems of Europe seemed terrible and clamant, and a return to the vast unconcern of London felt strange. There is a clamant public demand for a new law to protect children.
